subtitle: Thinking Allowed
Conversations on the leading edge of knowledge
and discovery with psychologist Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. Today we'll be exploring
Retrocognition and reincarnation. My guest is Wagner
Alegretti, who is the co-founder with Nanci Trivellato of the
International Academy of Consciousness. They have a beautiful campus in Portugal.
Wagner is originally Brazilian. He is author of
Retrocognitions, an
investigation of the memories of past lives and the periods between lives.
Welcome Wagner. Thank you. It's a pleasure being
here. It's a pleasure to be with you once again. It's
very interesting to me how your work really began as an
exploration of the out-of-body experience and
the human energy, the subtle energy systems
associated with out-of-body travel, but it led you into an
investigation of reincarnation. Yes, and in fact one of the
reasons for that, it's a kind of interesting thing, is that
retrocognition was the kind of phenomenon that I had not
experienced before. So I had my spontaneous out-of-body
experiences and sometimes some remote viewings and I
many times heard people discussing talking about their
retrocognition and that got me really curious. Why
haven't I never had any kind of experience like that?
So then I started studying and reading and
applying techniques to see if I could have my own.
So then I started having some of those experiences after
creating, I think, the right conditions. Some of them
happened spontaneously and it is interesting that
some people, some mediums, some psychic people,
they also told me about some of my past lives without knowing
anything about my own experiences and some of their accounts coincided
precisely with the memories that I got on my own.
Well, you've already raised a very
interesting point, which is the
supposition, and I think in your case it's been
proven out, that an adult human being without
resorting to past-life therapy or hypnosis is capable of accessing
retrocognitive information, including past
lives. Indeed, indeed. As with everything else,
we know that some people are naturally more
predisposed to have these kind of retrocognition,
but like working with energy or like leaving the body, if
we know techniques, if we apply some time, some discipline,
we can have our own experiences. The way I used to see or to understand this is that
recognition can be a very powerful tool for therapy,
for instance, if some people have some traumas or some
phobias and things like that. So in this case, as many times, hypnosis,
those forms of therapy, can be really indicated, could be positive.
But if we think, the way I think, that recognition is
a very powerful tool, a way of exploring ourselves, our
identity, memories, our past, we cannot rely on someone else to keep doing these
regressions throughout our life. So we have to have the means on our
hands by ourselves, and I think and I know this is definitely possible.
You engaged in a study including your own personal
experiences, and I'm assuming the experiences of
students. And students also, yes, because I started
giving a course about this many, many, many years ago.
So people would come to learn the techniques, and
many times they would share their own experiences.
And I compiled a lot of those results. And friends discussing
this, because I joined this kind of groups into the psych,
paranormal spirituality, a long time ago. And it
was very common for people to tell their stories.
And then also, of course, many books where people discuss their own experiences.
And I could start seeing like patterns, if you could classify different experiences.
That's why one of the chapters in my book is exactly the classification of these
recognitions. Like, for instance, some are spontaneous.
Others are provoked by an external source, like the therapist.
Some can be provoked by the person, himself or herself.
Some experiences are more emotional. Others are more intellectual, more of ideas.
Some experiences are positive, even if it can be a little bit hard for a while.
But some recognitions sometimes take the person out of a point
of balance, so they can put a person confused for some time.
So there are many different ways of classifying these experiences.
And certainly I could see that some factors, natural
factors, can predispose someone to recognitions, like the
hypnagogic state, dreams, sleep.
But some other factors that we can control can also
facilitate recognitions, like even leaving the body.
Because the memories that we have of past lives, they are not in our physical brain.
The physical brain does not contain those
memories, because it didn't exist at the time.
So these memories, they have to be somewhere else.
And we think is basically the first level of access to
them is our spiritual body, psychosoma, the astral body.
So when we are out of the body in a normal OBE,
it's much easier for us to access those memories.
So provoking OBEs is one of the ways of facilitating those out of our experiences.
Something else, when we were talking before about chakras
and we have these chakras in our head, these chakras are very
important because they work like an interface between our
power brain, the brain of this astral body and the physical
brain. But most of the people have these chakras not so well developed.
I could even dare to say it's they are a
little bit atrophied because of lack of use.
So some techniques with energy, like VELO, moving energy up
and down, triggering by will, our vibration state, they can
make these chakras get more and more active.
Let's define VELO for our viewers since you've used the term.
We call it Voluntary Energy Longitudinal Oscillation.
Translating this by our will, we move energy up and down inside of our body.
Little by little, we speed it up, getting faster and faster.
So when we reach enough speed and enough free volume of
this energy moving, we trigger this state that is called
vibrational state.
Robert Moreau discussed a lot about this vibrational
state and Modum and Kruco, people who studied out about
experiences. So when we get this vibrational state, it
makes the communication between this power brain, the
brain of this other subtle body we have, and the physical brain.
And this facilitates the retrocognition.
And I noticed this because many times in my life, I woke
up in the morning without remembering anything special
about that particular night.
So I thought, well, let me do my first energy work of
the day, just to start the day with as much energy as
possible. And then just there on my bed, I start moving
energy little by little, exactly as I just described, and
then more and more. When I got the vibrational state,
suddenly I remembered an OBE that I just had during that
night. So if I had not done that energy exercise,
I would never remember that particular OBE.
State specific memory.
So in this case, on my example, I remembered
that particular OBE that just happened.
But sometimes when people enter into longer sessions of this
energy work, you could even think of this as being a state of
energy mindfulness, because mindfulness is something very
old, of course, but nowadays people are more aware of it.
So people focus their attention on their breathing,
some sounds of the environment, but we can do the same.
And we think at a much deeper level when we start sensing our own energy.
So we focus our attention on our energy.
When you are moving your energies up and down, this absorbs
your focus, your attention so much that many times helps
you to create some, in lack of a better word, altered states of consciousness.
But altered, it's a kind of loaded word, because sometimes
when we say altered, people think it is by drugs, you
know, psilocybin or something like this.
But no, the consciousness can have many different modes of functioning.
So getting into the vibrational state, in fact, changes our state of consciousness.
So this helps us to access deeper memories, memories that we don't usually access.
And you're also very interested in the sometimes called
the intermission period, the state between incarnations.
Yes, it is interesting because in my courses, when I teach
about this, I say, look, we should try to remember our
past lives, to know exactly what we should not be doing.
We should not be repeating it here now.
And we should remember our last intermissive period or
the period between lives, to know what we should be doing
here. Because many of us, when we were during that period,
we were lucid, no intelligent, we were no conscious
enough to think about our past, to see what we needed to learn, to develop.
And we could plan the life we are having now.
And this is a kind of planning that we don't do alone.
We do with other people, people that we are going to
meet, perhaps your future wife, perhaps your parents.
So because our evolution doesn't happen, you know, separated, isolated from others.
So our life missions, in fact, they overlap.
There is our particular individual life mission.
But this has to be coherent with the life mission of people around us.
So when we remember these intermissive periods, many times
we know what we trained for, what we planned, because
this planning is not only writing in a kind of paper what we are going to do.
The book of life.
Exactly. But we are prepared for that.
And the analogy that I use in my courses, it's exactly
like when NASA is preparing astronauts for the next space
mission, suppose when now a few years when we go to Mars,
they have to get a big group of people, teach them a lot of
theoretical things, but a lot of practical situations,
simulating problems until they are ready enough to be put on
that kind of challenge is the same thing.
Because I remember and this is one of my most remarkable experience of recognition.
I remember when I was in this period between lives before
the conception of this body and I was thinking about
the body, sorry, about the life that I was about to start.
I remember my state of mind.
I had the vision of everything that I should do, the
complexity of it, the challenges and so many people involved.
I had a kind of a little form of expectation, a little bit
of anxiety with that, but not in the pathological sense.
Because I was seeing the complexity of so many people, so
many resources, and I could see how smart these other higher
consciousnesses, they have to be to put so many people
taking the best of their resources, their strong traits and
weak traits to help them and myself, of course, to develop
individually as much as possible, but also the way we can
help others because we evolve helping others to evolve.
Well, it seems as if you're implying that in addition to
planning a past life in conjunction with other people, there
are higher guides or spirits, higher consciousness available
with an even vaster perspective than you would have in an
out-of-body state.
Absolutely, absolutely.
For me, this is a fact because many times when I leave and
left my body, I met some of these helpers, mentors, spiritual
guides.
Many people use different names.
They are people like us.
They are, in most of the case, not all human
consciousnesses, but a few steps ahead in this evolution.
They are less emotional.
They are much smarter.
They are more cosmoethical.
They have a much better view of the consequences
of the actions or even of the omissions.
So many times I see them as being strategists, thinking of so many
different needs, opportunities, situations and how to make the
best of it.
What is interesting is that they know, and we know also because
of them, that many things cannot be accomplished in a single
life.
So there is a much bigger plan.
OK, let's get this group, this evolutionary group,
as we call it, to accomplish this in 20 lives.
Could be about 2000 years.
Suppose, for instance, if we think, OK, let us end war on this planet.
How many lifetimes would take 100,000 years?
More than 20 lifetimes.
Exactly.
So in the case of my evolutionary group, the main point of this
group life mission is to tell people, to clarify people, to
help them, to find by themselves.
They are not the physical body.
They are multidimensional consciousnesses.
We are beyond space and time and shape and gender, everything.
But certainly we need these vehicles, these automata, these
androids, to be able to interact with this dimension here.
And this requires a lot of planning.
So we are not just like a fish that is born in the
middle of the ocean, lives as much as possible and dies.
We are going to have a family.
And many times a lot of these people in our family, they were
with us together in past lives, sometimes with very good karma,
very good connections, but sometimes with some links that are not so easy.
So we have a second chance to fix some of these things.
So in the way we try to organize this, we have this idea of
the ego karma, the personal karma, the whole set of actions and
reactions of past lives that brought us here.
So we have strong points and big points there.
So part of our life mission is to improve our ego karma.
But for most of the people, the challenge is in the group karma.
So all the lovers we had in past lives, the people we
killed, the people who killed us, people we helped.
So now we see the context of the group we are part of.
But also there is this kind of more universal karma.
This is our position, our opportunity to help a much bigger community.
So it's the rest of the whole of humanity, but also
not only humanity, but even Earth, the ecosystem.
Because now we are killing a lot of plants and animals.
We are at least allowing a lot of extinction also.
What is going to be our karma?
And I used to give this, many times as an example, in some
of my speeches, I say, look, let us be very selfish, OK?
So what is the kind of planet you would like to find yourself in next life?
Eden, idyllic, or dystopian wasteland?
So we are going to face the karma of what we are doing with our planet now.
Next life, let us see if we can get the best.
I mean, it seems as if at this moment in time, we were 50-50 planet.
There are many, many beautiful, idyllic, paradise-like places on the
planet still, and many places that are very desolate and dystopian.
Oh, yes, yes.
And some have a good perspective of staying kind
of OK, but others, I think some places are already
beyond hope, so perhaps it is going to take a few
thousands of years for some places to recover.
And with this climate change, we really don't know if we are going
to have some change reactions, things getting out of control.
So, as you know, if the ice melts, you know, the soil
gets darker and then absorbs more heat from the sun.
We really don't know.
But I think that as more active, the more conscious
consciousnesses in this planet, we have a kind of responsibility,
obligation with the rest, I mean, with the
rest of the species, the rest of the animals.
And this is part of that universal karma there.
So the way I see recognition, like the out of body experience, is a very
good tool to help us to become more lucid, to know more about ourselves.
Can you imagine, for instance, if a person, let me give you just
one example, a person who is very, you know, macho, machistic.
If that person remembers a past life when he was a woman,
abused, ten children, you know, and having a very difficult life.
How would that person change now just by remembering that?
Imagine a very racist person now remembering a particular life when the person
was part of a minority, was a slave, I don't know, perhaps in Greece, in Egypt.
Now the person is going to see things differently.
I think one of the problems we have in life is that people lack references.
We are born this way in a particular family, and
then our spectrum of experience is a very small one.
But when we remember many lives, we have a much
bigger set of experience to base ourselves on.
So then our priorities, our sense of ethics, they change with that.
Many times we think like this, oh, if I could go back when I was a teenager, if I could go back
there, but with the maturity, the experience that I have now, how many things would be different?
I would do differently, yeah.
But we can do the opposite.
We can remember our past mistakes, experiences of so
many different lives to improve the way we are now.
Well, one of the points you seem to be addressing is the idea of a soul group.
And I get the sense from how you speak that you sense yourself as
part of a soul group that has a mission well beyond one lifetime.
Perfectly, perfectly.
And we see this because what we notice is
that people evolve in groups, changing roles.
So today I'm the father of my son, but perhaps
in a past life he was my father, my friend.
We keep rolling, changing, you know, places there, but basically evolve in a group.
We call this, just to simplify, a kind of spiritual family.
So many times when these people die and then they meet in
the extra physical, as we say, they get together by affinity.
There we have the best of our friends, but also the worst of our enemies.
Enemies are part of this kind of karmic group also.
So certainly this group expands over time because throughout, for
instance, medieval times, our circle of relations was very small.
But nowadays, in a week, we can see more people than we saw
and met throughout our whole life during medieval times.
Nowadays, with Internet, with Zoom and with streaming and so
many courses, this was completely blown out of proportion.
This is sci-fi for the consciousness.
And this is only going to get more complex.
So what we see is that these very small groups, they are expanding,
expanding to the point this spiritual family is becoming the whole.
It's become, at least to simplify, the whole of humanity.
But a lot of things are getting more and more complex.
So if we think of us in the last 10,000 years since the agricultural revolution, because
we were nomads, hunters, gatherers for thousands and hundreds of thousands of years.
We had a particular way of living.
It was very simple, getting food, moving around.
But once we had the agricultural revolution, that changed us because then we stayed
in a particular place and then we started having the idea of a property, memory.
Oh, my grandfather was born in that place.
This happened there.
So there was this accumulation of knowledge.
This changed us a lot.
And it has been like that for 10,000 years.
But now we are facing so many changes and so fast and we
have to adapt and human beings are very slow to adapt.
And one thing that I have noticed that is very interesting, even in terms of a philosophical
point of view, is that in the past we had we had very little space for our for our free will.
We ate the food that was available.
We would basically inherit the profession,
the abilities of our of our father or mother.
If we were lucky enough, we would inherit some land there.
So we didn't have to decide.
We just went with the flow.
But nowadays, I see a lot of people, some of those many times
come to me for these personal sessions and they are lost.
They have so many possibilities, space for decision.
They feel confused and they enter into a state of agitation,
anxiety, depression, because they don't know what to do.
The supermarket of possibilities now is too big for a monkey brain to disentangle.
And of course, there are professions that exist today that never existed.
I mean, what you do, for example, is entirely unique.
Exactly, exactly.
And some professions, they disappeared completely.
You know, a shoemaker basically disappeared.
You know, a chimney cleaner, no, doesn't exist anymore.
And now with AI, my goodness, let us see how adaptable we can be.
I think there are levels of reality and reality can be very
different, depending on which level you're focusing on.
So at one level, the mystics will say, we are one with everything.
I like that level to be that sort of the foundation of reality, one with everything.
But if we're talking reincarnation, that's a very different level.
You're not one with everything.
You're one with a particular sequence of lifetimes.
Yes, there is this sense of identity.
I think that deep, deep, deep down there, we are all connected.
Perhaps we are just expressions of a
different, you know, huge cosmic consciousness.
But in practical terms, we are individuals.
We have our own stories.
We have memories of many lives.
And this can go throughout many thousands of years.
And we have this very strong sense of identity.
And some models, some theories, they say that
this bigger consciousness evolves through this
individuation, this kind of personalized
experience of so many different possibilities.
Makes sense to me.
Yes, because we can expand the spectrum of possibilities there.
One person is very creative.
The other one is very analytical.
One person, for instance, deals mostly with the physical body and action.
The other one more with the intellect.
And I think this diversity of manifestations is important to all of us.
But for practical, pragmatic, you know, uses terms, I think that we are very much
individualized because we see that when people
die, they go to other dimensions and they
are still basically the same person.
I met my grandfather who died many years ago.
He was a lot younger, looking younger, different face.
But the identity, the type of energy, the energy signature was exactly the same.
And I could identify him.
He remembered me.
I met my son before he was conceived.
And this is one of the most remarkable out of our experience I had.
I left my body when I was still living in SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil.
I went to the living room and I saw this
toddler, this young boy there smiling at me.
And I thought, who is this guy?
What is this spirit?
Entity doing here.
When I got closer to him, he opened his arm, like inviting me to hug him.

I thought, who is this guy?
And then suddenly I got this kind of telepathy or
this intuition that I was going to be his father.
The surprise made me return to my body.
And I woke up, sat there by the edge of the bed for a long time, thinking I didn't see,
didn't say anything about that to my first wife.
But I knew we were going to be parents.
After a while, we got a confirmation that she was pregnant.
And then I told her, is going to be a boy, he
is going to be blonde, is going to have this
behavior, described a lot of things about him.
So as he grew, I could see exactly him the way he was just before being conceived.
I'm very interested in the hug that you had, because now you're out of your body.
But I think the term that you use is parabody.
Parabody.
What happens is when we go to other
dimensions, sometimes we have our psychosomal
parabody, very dense, almost physical.
In other experiences, we can be lighter, lighter.
So there are many different dimensions.
Sometimes you go to dimensions, they are almost like immaterial.

But in that case, because I was close to my physical body, so it was a distance of a

And perhaps because I was very dense at the time, and that spirit who was going to

But sometimes when we leave the body,
suppose you meet another consciousness who is
much more subtle.
Sometimes you can pass even your para arm through it, because it is a slightly

And this is, in fact, one of the most interesting things in terms of the OBE.
I am very much intrigued by this idea of the dimensions, because there are so many
different realities and they coexist, they interpenetrate themselves without

It's not only in terms of vibration or energy.
There is some kind of different geometry
also, because sometimes I got out of my body
and it was difficult to visually interpret what I was seeing, because, for instance,
perspective, parallax, all this visual interpretation that the brain does was
different.
The whole geometry is different.
Yes, you see a road, it remains parallel all the time.
It doesn't converge.
So it's different.
So it's like a kid who is learning how to interpret senses and vision and distance.
Many times we are outside of the body, learning how to adapt to those that we
call para perceptions, perceptions beyond the physical ones.
You've also used the term, if I recall correctly, energy coupling.
Sometimes you may couple with another individual to the extent that you feel
yourself being that person.
And it doesn't mean it was a past life of yours.
Exactly.
This kind of energy coupling can happen many times spontaneously.
Some people are very sensitive.
They can get close to a person and then after a while they can feel anxious if the

They can feel, for instance, a headache if the person has a headache or is prone to

This can be done intentionally, because when you transmit energy to someone, the

That's the energy coupling or auric coupling.

In some cases I could confirm because I described to the person, look, I saw a

Sometimes some people told me, oh yes, this is one of the previous past lives that

Someone described exactly that same thing to me.
But when I see this, I feel and I see them as being external to me.
It's not my own memory.
It's like you watch a movie, you see a lot of things, but you know those were not

There is a difference of quality, of identification there.
But certainly this is a very important thing because many times people have

We have to be very careful with that because we can read a book, we can watch a

So then what I say and have there in my book is we have to wait, we have to be

So I have some notes, my own reports there of experiences that I had, but I

I have there, you know, experience to be confirmed, but sometimes a particular

And then you can see more and more and this thing is coherent and many times

You can find there the consciousness who is now your father, your spouse, your
kid. You can see, ah, this is why I have this particular trait, this behavior.
So things match perfectly.
But we have to be patient.
I have seen a lot of people who have one single little fragmented experience and
they say, OK, I was there in Egypt, I was a pharaoh, whatever.
I would imagine that there are gray areas, like how do you distinguish between, for
example, a spiritual guide and a past life figure?
The spiritual guide is something that you perceive in the now.
So I use this expression, retrocognition, to know something from the past.
There is the simulcognition to know, to be aware of the present moment.
You are living now, a simulcognition.
We are aware, perceiving, thinking about this.
We are here now.
You are here now and we are sure of that, or we should.
But also we can have a precognition.
We can know something before it happens.
And I had a few of those, very, very interesting.
So this shows that the consciousness is not so much limited by time.
So when I perceive, I feel a helper, I feel, or a spiritual guide, I feel as
something happening now.
Many times it's like someone coming, entering, passing through the door.
I know the person is here.
You can talk, you can discuss things there.
But when you have a retrocognition, it's basically remembering something.
You don't change that.
But some of our retrocognitions, they can be so full, they can be so thorough, so

Because instead of seeing things from the outside, because some of our

You feel here and you are watching something like in a screen, out of you.

You can feel the pleasure, the pain, the thoughts, the emotions of that time.

It's almost like if you were possessing someone, but we know it was us.
So some people, when they discuss, study retrocognitions, they think
it's a real time travel.

Christopher Reeves.
Was somewhere in time.
I don't know if you watch that movie.
Christopher Reeves, Somewhere in Time.

Do you know what is interesting?
A very interesting experience.
In one of our trips to Japan, Nanci and I were in Kyoto.
And we like very much to walk around.
We don't take taxis or the tube.
We were exploring those little straight alleys and we enter a very particular

Both of us stopped in a corner there, stayed there silent for awhile.

Look at that corner.
I had this very strong perception of familiarity with that place.
I saw a scene of us being here.
And what happens is that she had the same

So many times this helps us to think, look, this is not only my imagination.
Why this would happen only there, both of us, because I could have this kind of

Nancy could have this in some other place.

We have an independent person there.
Making sure nobody enters there.
